channel.title: Help With Fixing A Client
channel.description:
Okay, I'm trying to use SlashScape client, and I keep getting this error once i run it. (Yes, I've removed the anti-leech).
[CODE]SlashScape #474 Client Emulation - Revision 1.0 java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Sou rce) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$6.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getChainedException(Unkno wn Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:109) at Update.<init>(Update.java:27) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:3572) at client.startUp(client.java:7186) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4653) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source) at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at java.net.Socket.connect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.NetworkClient.doConnect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.<init>(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(Unknown Sour ce) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHeaderField(Unknown So urce) at java.net.URLConnection.getHeaderFieldInt(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLConnection.getContentLength(Unknown Source) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:104) ... 6 more error [/CODE]
Any thoughts on how to fix this? Thanks.

item.title: Help With Fixing A Client
item.dc:creator: @nicks nicks
item.description:
@nicks wrote:

umm it looks like somthing wrong with ur java have u ran other servers?

item.title: Help With Fixing A Client
item.dc:creator: @kool_dude567 kool dude567
item.description:
@kool_dude567 wrote:

Okay, I’m trying to use SlashScape client, and I keep getting this error once i run it. (Yes, I’ve removed the anti-leech).

[CODE]SlashScape #474 Client Emulation - Revision 1.0
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect
